body:
This is not working for OS X [1], I'll find a working solution

[1] https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-distributedlog/jobs/147085916

The new configuration builds for OSX [1] and Linux [2].

[1] https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-distributedlog/jobs/147087414
[2] https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-distributedlog/jobs/147087413
The change looks good to me. But I will first port the bookkeeper merge-pr script to distributedlog. Then merge the pr can automatically close the corresponding ticket.
I created a jira https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DL-16 to port the merge script.

Also I am thinking of cloning the process of BookKeeper about pull-requests and merge scripts. 

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/BOOKKEEPER/Contributing+to+BookKeeper
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/BOOKKEEPER/Patch+Sumission

So it would be making sense to change this pull request title to be "DL-14: Update travis' configuration file". so when we close this pr request, there will be comments updated on DL-14. (as we enabled the github integration hooks at INFRA-12245.

@franckcuny you may have seen this already, but just in case you may want to have a look at the instructions here:

http://www.apache.org/dev/licensing-howto.html

This looks good to me! +1

But can you create a jira under https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DL and changed the pull request title to be "DL-XXX: ...".

So the pull request will be connected with a jira ticket.

The change looks good to me. +1

(we got a clean successful check on travis-ci)

The change looks good to me. +1.

(regarding the ci check failure, created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DL-22 for tracking the flaky test)

The notice file looks good to me. +1.

@fpj did you see any problem here?

@franckcuny @sijie It looks good, but I haven't done an inspection of dependencies and such to determine whether we have anything we need to add to the notice file. That's main reason why I shared the link above.
This is a lucky one, lol
This one is quite tricky, I'm not able to reproduce the same problem on my local machine. Maybe due to the different building environment?
Done. Somehow not able to assign the issue to myself. Everything else is taken care of :)

@arvindkandhare I just added you to contributor list and assigned that ticket to you. so we are good now. 

we are working on porting the merge-pr.py script from bookkeeper ( @franckcuny is helping on that ). Once we have the script in, we will start merging these pull requests.
Creating a JIRA ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DL-26 for tracking Travis CI build failure.

LGTM +1. Let's merge this pull request using it :D 

Also, I created a wiki page for 'committer workflow' - do you mind filling up the information on how to use this script for committers?

https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/DL/Committer+Workflow
I'll update the wiki.
LGTM +1
LGTM +1

@franckcuny I merged this pull request. but because the commit message doesn't contain 'close #6' message. so asfgit doesn't close this pull request. Can you manually close this pull request?

The fix for the merge script is on https://github.com/apache/incubator-distributedlog/pull/6. If it is okay to you, can you try to merge that? it would help testing if you have permissions to push the change to apache.
LGTM
This change has been merged.

LGTM +1

LGTM +1 thanks @jiazhai 

(btw, I like the way how you organized the module description)
@franckcuny can you review this also? I'd like to have a second eye on documentation.
LGTM. It's a good starting point, we can improve from here.
LGTM

I'm unable to run successfully `mvn findbugs:findbugs` at the moment, I keep hitting this issue:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project distributedlog-core: Could not resolve dependencies for project com.twitter:distributedlog-core:jar:0.3.51-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact com.twitter:distributedlog-protocol:jar:0.3.51-SNAPSHOT in bookkeeper-twitter-mvn-repo (https://raw.github.com/twitter/bookkeeper/mvn-repo/4.3.5-TWTTR-OSS) -> [Help 1]
```

It looks like the name on GitHub is RELEASE4.3.5-TWTTR-OSS
@franckcuny you are faster than me. I was planning to send a change out :D
Thanks a lot for all of your help and review.
#SHIPIT
@franckcuny I think you might need to run `mvn clean install -DskipTests` first and then run `mvn findbugs:findbugs`. `Findbugs` runs when the code is compiled.
Also, I think we also need to make code changes to address findbugs errors if there are any.
The change looks good to me. +1
LGTM +1. thanks @crazysoftwarecoder

Criss crossing from one site to another like this is awkward. 

Why cant we just use sphinx?

Its also a lot of irritating web code to have to maintain.
LGTM, i assume all of the packages will build and run fine with example scripts

@leighst @khurrumnasimm I commented in the email thread. I am kind of agreeing with Leigh about the focus on DistributedLog. however I also wouldn't discourage the work here. It might be good to keep the module under distributedlog-tutorials or move to 'distributedlog-contribs' to keep the project focused.
LGTM +1.
Can anyone review my pull request?
Nice attempt, @jiazhai . In general, looks good to me. +1
looks good to me. +1
this sounds reasonable to me. it actually simplifies things. +1
the overall change looks good. Let me take a look at the bk change and plan how to merge this. @arvindkandhare
@franckcuny for the DL-29, the simplest fix is to replace rstrip() with strip() as the delete branches use "startWith" to filter out all the temp branches.
LGTM
LGTM

LGTM

I wish there was a better way than this shell script to achieve the same result.

just realized that @jderrickk was doing the same same at #19
+1, shipit

the title is actually not correct. it has be to in the format of "DL-XXX: ...". Can you create a DL ticket and update the title?
nvm I think it is merge script problem.
LGTM +1
check https://github.com/sijie/incubator-distributedlog/tree/sijie/update_readme for how does the latest README.md look like
@leighst I will go ahead and merge this. any objections?
I merged and rebuilt the site. it is live now - http://distributedlog.incubator.apache.org/technical-review/2015/09/19/kafka-vs-distributedlog.html
@leighst fixed the broken ledger url and the post date
@leighst I fixed the post date but left the permalink unchanged. http://distributedlog.incubator.apache.org/technical-review/2015/09/19/kafka-vs-distributedlog.html
@leighst FYI. I merged this pull request.
@leighst can you ship this? I'd like to push the new README file.
How feasible would it be to configure this as an Ansible playbook - executable documentation and all that?

It would not be too difficult. However, I don't think this should be in this repo if we create such things. We could create a new repository regarding ansible. (If we think it's worthwhile I don't mind starting that, I've some experience with both DLog and ansible :)
+1 for the idea. @franckcuny I don't have an experience with ansible. so I will just defer this to you :D
@leighst @franckcuny @mgodave can any of you take a look at this? I'd like to get the README updated and then I will sync the twitter github repo with this one.
lgtm
lgtm
+1 for the Ansible playbook. when do you guys think it can be available?
LGTM. Thank you for fixing the broken links.
LGTM +1

@jiazhai it would good that you can send out the second part of this change. I took a look at this change initially. the layout seems to be fine. I would like to see how will you change the server side and decide later on. /cc @leighst 

also, this change is touching quite bunch of files. it will definitely conflict with the repackaging change made by @khurrumnasimm . so we'd coordinate on merging them.
ping @franckcuny
@arvindkandhare is the [twitter/bookkeeper#4](https://github.com/twitter/bookkeeper/pull/4) change finalized?
@sijie The BK changes are final and ready to be checked in once you are satisfied with them. This particular pull request still needs a couple of changes.
LGTM
LGTM

@khurrumnasimm thank you so much for your effort. This is not a trivial change. I think most of changes are just renaming files and package names. so +1 from me. 

but I'd like to see what other people's opinion. @leighst ?

@jderrickk I think the change is making the namespace management become much complicated.

I had a brief discussion with @leighst offline about the naming management in DL. I think we should probably just stick into one naming convention. for example, we probably can just support zookeeper file-path like name. so 1) we can simply map the stream name to the path of zookeeper metadata; 2) this allow application manages how their streams will be organized in their own hierarchical.

@leighst can you also take a look at this?

I think it might be a good direction to go down to have a write-protocol specific client or service. so it is easy to extend in future, like adding gRPC support and such.

I am not sure if we should support this. I had the same feeling with @leighst - I don't think we can find a reliable to use transaction id for offset.

I am actually thinking in a different solution - we already have the length field for each entry appended to bookkeeper ledger. we probably can just expose this length field to the log segment metadata (like what we did for sequence id). so those length field can be used as the offset for batch of records (aka entries). does that meet your requirement, @khurrumnasimm ? /cc @leighst
@franckcuny I think findbugs was added in #19 . mind closing this PR?
@sijie sounds good to me. I am fine with single naming convention. I will update the pull request.

@sijie @leighst  thank you so much for your comments. I agreed with you after trying a while, it turns out is a bit hard to get an offset generator correctly on write proxy. I will fall back to use sequence id for my use case now. I will close the pull request and create a jira to expose offset.
ping again @leighst @sijie
LGTM +1
@khurrumnasimm sorry for being late. the change LGTM. +1
@arvindkandhare @jiazhai I will merge the bk change and produce a new version this week.
@khurrumnasimm Any updates about this?
looking at this now
#shipit
